bibl.title: Letter from William B. Bean to Philip Showalter Hench, January 5, 1951

div1.p: Bean inquires if any plans have been made for a celebration of the centennial of Walter Reed's birth. If not, Bean will propose the idea to people at his alma mater, the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from William B. Bean to Philip Showalter Hench, January 5, 1951
div1.opener:
STATE UNIVERSITY OF IOWA
UNIVERSITY HOSPITALS
DEPARTMENT OF INTERNAL MEDICINE
----
IOWA CITY, IOWA
January 5, 1951
Dr. Phillip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
As I recall you have had a great interest in Walter
Reed, and I wonder in view of the coming anniversary of his
birth, I believe September 13, of this year, whether you
know of any appropriate ceremonies or centennial celebration
which are planned. Do you think it would be wise to suggest
something of this type to people at the University of
Virginia since this is my alma mater? If you are aware of
nothing else I will take the matter in hand but thought you
might know whether or not anything was being planned. Let
me hear from you when you have a chance.
div1.closer: Sincerely, WILLIAM B. BEAN, M. D. WBB:lwa
